Issue.creator: avkrishnan
Issue.summary: As a CLI user I should be able to approve a connection request
Issue.description: Given I've received a connection request: 1. I should be able to see that I have a connection request1.1 I should be able to see information about the requester 2. I should be able to approve/accept the connection request3. The requester should be notified that I accepted the connection request. 4. If I "deny" the connection request, nothing should happen.5. If I accept the connection request, I should have a secure connection established between me (the CLI user) and the other Identity (could be another CLI user acting as another institution or individual Identity Owner).Suggested text for incoming connection request: "New connection request from requester's DID OR user-friendly name for that DID . Type "approve" to approve or "deny" to deny. Type "request connection help" for more information."6. Typing "request connection help" should show me some more helpful information about what approving or denying a connection does. Some example explaining text: "Approving a connection request will add the requester to your list of connections. You can message and share verifiable claims and proofs with connections.""Denying a request will ignore the connection request, and the requester will not be notified.""You can remove a connection by typing __________ "*POA*_Assumptions_* Incoming connection request handler add connection request to link in the same way as `load` command adds info to links._POA steps_* Once user sees any incoming connection request in CLI. User can issue an `accept invitation` command.* Check if receiver user is not a SPONSOR, then we can't add incoming identifier on sovrin, in this case use incoming identifier as it is.
